problem.p: Suppose you throw two fair six-sided dice at the same time. Let random variable \(X\) be the sum of the faces.
(Indicate a set by listing its elements in ascending order without spaces, enclosed in curly braces, e.g., {2,4}.)

ul.li: How many distinct events do we have?
Which outcome in the sample space \(\Omega\) has the highest probability of occuring?
What is the probability of the outcome in the previous question?
Let \(E\) be the event that the sum of the two dice is a perfect square. What is the probability of \(E\), \(P(E)\)?
